items.title: Ten Million Corals Are in the Path of a Federal Dredging Project in Florida
items.description: Beneath the surface of one of South Florida’s busiest maritime hubs, Port Everglades, scientists found 10 million corals thriving in and around the main channel traversed daily by cargo and cruise ships, now threatened by a major federal dredging project.  The discovery, detailed in a new scientific analysis by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration […]

items.title: Why New York City Is Spending Millions on ‘Bluebelts’
items.description: New York City is expected to experience increasing rainfall over the next few decades, especially during cloudbursts—short, intense rainfall events. When rain falls, light showers can usually be handled by the complex network of sewer pipes that run beneath the city.
